description: All my favorite mornings are spent here. If I'm just running in to grab a coffee before my muni shows up or sitting down to work on my laptop for a little while I love this place. Mostly because I love the staff so much!! Always friendly and they really put care into each food order even when it gets busy. I love the oatmeal. I hear the place is changing  management- I really hope it retains the same friendly neighborhood feel this place has done such a good job to create.
author: Liza S.

description: I really enjoy this coffee spot. Coffee is great along with all the pastries. The sandwich's are reasonably priced and good. Staff are all very friendly! Nice location on the corner with public transportation and outside benches.
author: Manny R.

description:
As per the sleepy neighborhood I've come to know as home over the years, this cafe does not have late hours and the pace of service is very CHILL. Not the sort of place that, despite the efforts of the staff, will attend to a line during rush hour at hyper speed, and it's not laid out for crowds either.
The smoothies they make only come in one large size, but they're delicious and with spinach, mango, almond milk and banana- I consider that a substantial meal anyway. 
Not a lot of food options for dietary restrictions, but great quality espresso and overall a very chill place to pick up something and go, or better yet, take a break on the way home - so long as it's before 6pm.
author: Kristina B.

description: Another good morning with Cafe Xo Oatmeal. Super delicious, comes with bananas and strawberries.
author: Sumbal A.

description: he was my first time coming to have a snack I could say while doing laundry at this Cafe and I enjoyed myself with my spouse a wonderful Slice of Cheesecake and French roasted coffee but what I like the most is the service how I was greeted when I first came in and the wonderful presentation of The Slice of Cheesecake which look too good to eat but I could not keep myself from it so if you are doing laundry or just want to hang out and relax I would recommend for you to stop by at Cafe EXO and enjoy yourself a slice of cake or any pastry that they have at hand
author: Laura M.

description: Best chai latte (both iced and hot) I've ever had, hands down. Also the staff couldn't be nicer. Love this place.
author: Chad H.

description: When the sign says open until 2pm it's bad form to rudely kick us out at 1:30pm complaining about all the cleaning you have to do. Then change the damn sign. Close earlier.
author: Jeremy W.

description: Came in for an early morning coffee! Lots of regulars, good pastry/food selection. The barista was very nice and the line moved quickly! A great spot to relax and enjoy a coffee or grab a cup to go.
author: Kelly M.

description:
Like everything, one rates a cafe depending what you are looking for. In my case, I am looking for the for the following:

- Friendly staff that remembers my name and make me feel at home
- Chill place where I can sit down and do some work without having to deal with the noise and the crowd you would normally find at most cafes during the weekend. 
- Good quality food and a largish menu (for a cafe) that allows me eat more than just muffins on the days I decide to stay longer than an hour. 
- sockets to plug my lap top and not be restricted by the battery life of any of my devices. 
- a nice neighbourhood atmosphere. 

If you are like me, this is your place too!
author: Rodrigo B.

description:
The short: good apple cider

After a long roundabout hike up to Billy Goat Hill Park, my friend and I randomly decided to stop here. My friend ordered their apple cider, and for a foggy, chilly day on a typical SF summer day, the drink was so welcomed! There were lovely hints of apple, cinnamon, and an actual lemon slice that made the drink taste so much better.

There are also outlets on the wall, so it's a good place to recharge the phone or to sit and do some work.

This place was also the first time seeing the place as Airbnb recommended or local favorite or something similar.
author: Catherine W.

description: Biscotti wasn't hard, but it was super sweet! It tasted like a marshmallow, and I've had bad biscotti before. This takes the cake for bad biscotti. Latte wasn't bad, but the foam wasn't very good... My main complaint is that a biscotti cost me about $3??? A single one. Coffee was like around $3.
author: Ari F.

description: I've gone here several times now, it's a ripoff off any way you look at it. Example today the pastry was so hard that it hurt my teeth biting into it and my teeth are fine, they are aching from that biscotti, they try to be sneaky in charges, and try to serve you a bigger portion than you order, just nasty.
author: Babar Y.

description: I came here to wait for an apartment viewing. The decor is like someone's old dining room. It is very cozy. The staff was really warm and friendly. They have outlets and Wi-Fi which is a key for getting anything done. I got a tuna salad sandwich that was huge!! The salad that accompanied it was really fresh as well. They gave me a whole pot or tea not just a cup with a tea bag. If you have a minute to chill or want to get some work done, this is the place to hang.
author: Anne S.

description: The people who work here are friendly, that's the best thing the Cafe has going for it. The coffee is not good.  I appreciate them not having individual sugar packets creating less trash but their bins of sugar are gross.   The food is bad.  The pastries are lackluster.  On my last visit I had a piece of quiche, it was disgusting. I could only eat half and it left me sick for a day.  What I find as horrible customer service is there is a minimum dollar amount to use a credit card. It's 2017, get a real payment system or accept that with the cost of doing business there is a fee for credit card transactions.  I won't be returning, my stomach won't let me.
author: Joan P.

description:
About 9:30 this morning stopped by usual for Coffee & Bagel Cream Cheese. I've been coming here for over 3 years, lately it hasn't been the same. As of today this morning, got my usual coffee & bagel cream cheese, it was BAD, my coffee was colder side, my bagel with cheese wasn't the same, cream cheese on one side of the bagel. The Pastry seems been seating on the counter for ages, and the worse of all a fly was inside one of the cake sitting on the counter with the lid on. Be careful what you eat here especially Pastries & cakes. I have witnessed seeing so many pastries sitting there has been old never had fresh one. 
Therefore, I had enough of Cafe XO. Poor old Pastries as I watched every morning and Coffee not as Hot as it should, Bagel not enough cheese. Good bye Cafe XO, you really let me down.  You're better Off buying bagel on 24th Street lesser price with cheese and coffee at Starbuck which I bought later on today. Safe a lot $$.
author: Lupe P.

description:
I was in the neighborhood with some time to kill, and dropped in for a coffee on a Sunday afternoon. The signs for the homemade chocolate and almond croissant were just too tempting, so I ended up ordering one of those alongside a large iced coffee. The total was $7 (seemed reasonable), and both items were on the counter in front of me before my credit card had finished processing. Very prompt and friendly service!

The ambience of the cafe is quite nice, with large windows and ample seating. Two hours passed in a flash, and the croissant (which was delicious) disappeared long before then!

The wifi was spotty, but otherwise this place was just perfect. If I am in the neighborhood again, I will be sure to return.
author: Kat C.

description: I come to XO everyday during the week(i work down the street), Betty and Cynthia already know my order so i hardly ever wait. The food is great here the service is amazing. Pop in for a slice of the best poppyseed cake you've ever had!
author: Lulu R.

description: I love this place! I'm from Brooklyn and a total coffee snob. The coffee is excellent and they're super friendly.
author: Hilary B.

description: This breakfast cafe experience was underwhelming to say the least. We came in for a quick breakfast and got 2 coffees, 1 almond-chocolate croissant and 2 bagels with lox spread, costing $18! The croissant was good, and the coffee was basic, but the bagels were horrible. The bagels cost $4 each to have lox spread - they hardly put any cream cheese lox spread on it and it didn't have any pieces of real lox in it. There wasn't enough to cover both sides of the bagel (or even one half!) when opening the bagel. It was a joke amount of spread and very upsetting that they charged so much for that. The bagel bread wasn't great either. I would not go back.
author: Rachael B.

description: My neighborhood coffee shop. Serving lots of yummy homemade pastries, the bread pudding is a stand-out and worth the calories! Lots of tables, some outdoor seating and quiet seating inside in the back of the shop. Great friendly service, a local favorite!
author: Brian S.

description:
Food 
Tuna melt - nice it came with a salad. Pretty good and chunky tuna
Ice coffee 

Service 
Nice workers. For some reason there's free wifi via the Cablewifi

Atmosphere 
I love it it's cute and has a pastry boutique feel not too assuming tho few tables and I like the big taller tables for stool seating I like those. There's a bathroom in back and not sure about the outlet situation for next time if I decide I want to work from a cafe
author: Angela L.

description: I love this place and the food is really great.... The sign says they close at 6pm so I went in there to order a sandwich at 5pm and they told me they closed at 4:30pm and wouldn't serve me. What time do they stop serving?
author: Candace C.

description: Food was okay, but service was awful. We ordered two slices of quiche (hot), a hot chocolate, a chai and a bagel with egg and cheese. The woman taking orders spoke English with a heavy accent, and when my husband chose a cinnamon-raisin bagel she asked if we really wanted just cream cheese. We said egg and cheese again. The food came up and the quiche was cold in the middle. The bagel never came. We noticed a lonely bagel with just cream cheese sitting on the counter and inquired if it was ours. It was. We politely explained that we'd ordered egg and cheese, offered to pay any difference in price, and were told it wasn't usual to put egg and cheese on a cinnamon-raisin bagel. The woman at the counter proceeded to complain in Spanish to her co-worker about "empty-headed asshole customers". Of course we understood her (my husband is half-Mexican, and I speak several languages). We ate and left and won't be going back. Some people in the service trades need to check the chips on their shoulders. We were being nice and just trying to get what we actually ordered. I hope the owners read this and have a chat with her, because she sucks at her job.
author: Danese C.

description: The man behind was rude, the food was mediocre at best. Something positive...they have free wifi? There are much better places to go in the neighborhood.
author: Sandy C.

description: Delicious bagels and coffee! Plus they serve my favorite - Mighty Leaf tea! Will definitely be back!
author: Sammi P.

description: I ordered the lox bagel with capers and tomatoes. The bagel came out warm. The bagel was packed with lox and cream cheese. The tomatoes provided a nice refreshing component to the bagel. Overall, it was very filling.
author: James S.

description: On Sunday, it took a good 5 minutes to actually get the attention of the female cashier and her coworker who were both speaking Spanish.  There was no acknowledgment of a "Be right with you or Good morning, how may I help you?"  I had to pry to get attention like pulling teeth just to get a cup of coffee.  This place may have a cozy atmosphere but the service is extremely lacking.
author: Cindy M.

description:
Was so excited to discover this neighborhood spot in Noe Valley. If you love cafes with yummy food, free wifi, comfy seats, and plenty of outlets - you'll love Cafe XO. Staff are nice and self-serve ice water (with large glasses) is much appreciated. The home-made almond and almond/chocolate croissants are delicious.

I'm torn about sharing this gem since I don't want it to become hard to get a seat here, but I wanted to give the Cafe some love since it took me awhile to check this place out because of the current 3.5 star Yelp rating. It's now become my preferred place to bring my laptop to get some work done in the 'hood!
author: Jamay L.

description:
You know I'm a sucker for great service and would give an extra start for great service even tho the food is not so good!  Don't get me wrong, the lemon poppy seed cake I had was awesome!  And the ice latte was also great but I love how the cashier was trying to make simple conversation and smile the whole time, made my day even brighter than it already is!

Environment is small and cozy, not a lot of room for kids but I like it!
author: Wailun Eugene W.

description: The food is not worth the cost. I purchased a piece of quiche and it cost 7.50. It tasted stale and I threw it out. I thought  it was the wrong price so I called to ask and, yes, it cost that much. I got a croissant today and it was unevenly cooked, way too dense and dry. A cafe should be able to make a good croissant. They might have to charge more because of location, but the food should be good.
author: Lem B.

description:
I really wanted to love this place, but poor service is only excusable at a Chinese restaurant (where price and yumminess outshine rudeness!).  

The woman behind the counter chose talking to her friend over taking my order and I didn't see her smile to any of the customers.  I think it might have been the same cashier as these other two star reviews I'm seeing.  I got excited over the stacks of baked goods behind the counter, but my oatmeal cookie was too sweet and tasted like something store-bought.  There also aren't any labels, so I wasn't sure of what everything was.

Tips and Tricks:
-If you're getting the tea for-here, you're really just paying extra for more hot water (you still only get one tea bag).
-Bottled water is $2!
author: Jessica L.

description:
The food is good and I would suggest their
French roast coffee. The place is also
Reasonably priced and seems to draw in a lot of locals. Thanks
author: Alexander M.

description: Intimate cafe with a wide selection of homemade pastries, sandwiches, and salads. A great spot if you're looking to get some work done with lots of outlets nearby.
author: Victoria C.

description:
Oh every street corner should have a Cafe XO!

From the delicious treats to the teas, decor and tables outdoors, this is the perfect cafe!

I feel like I'm in France when I am here.  Oh la la!
author: AnneMarie W.

description:
I come to Cafe XO for coffee, bagels and their homemade chocolate almond croissants. The coffee and bagel I would rank as average. They are always very accommodating about special requests I have for my bagel, but don't always have all of the toppings listed on the menu available. The chocolate almond croissant is the bomb -- flakey, chocolatey, and small enough to make me not feel guilty.

The best part of Cafe XO is its location. Its right next to the 30th & Church MUNI stop so I end up going here when I have a spare 10 minutes while waiting for the train. The seats outside also make for good people watching on a sunny weekend.
author: Amy T.

description:
The breakfast are super good ! 
Nice place to work with a fresh squeeze orange juice or a good hot chocolat !
author: Amandine I.

description:
I'm an old-school "customer is always right" type of customer, and the ladies here provide service exactly as I request; they pour my Americano exactly as I like it: half-full which is not half water plus the 4 ounces of espresso. They greet me with a smile, with efficiency, and know me by name now. 

My favorites: sticky bun, chocolate croissant, coffee cake, and their pies. I haven't stopped over for lunch so my review is limited to the above. This is my neighborhood go-to spot and I drop by btw 2-4 times a week. I approve this message.
author: Patrick C.

description: The quiche was great and the fresh squeezed OJ delightful. Better yet is the service. The cashier pulled one way train fare from the tip jar to save me a trip to the ATM. Customer for life on a move like that.
author: Jon C.

description: Not to happy with a lady coming out to the front with a raw turkey in a pan, putting it on the counter and starts making cappuccinos with the same dirty raw meat *contaminated gloves!
author: Taran C.

description: Good lighting and great food. I had a chicken salad sandwich and it was delicious.
author: Amy L.

description: The best shortbread cookies in San Francisco. Always pleasant staff. Fast, stable wifi.
author: Inigo M.

description:
I had never really spent much time in this part of San Francisco, but when I stumbled across this small and quaint coffee shop I was impressed. The staff was very friendly and smiled at me as I walked in the door. The shop was pretty busy with about 7 tables inside occupied by happy people and people standing in a fast moving line. If tables are full,  you can sit at tables outside and enjoy the day. 

I ordered a latte which came quickly and perfectly foamed. It tasted delicious and needed barely any alterations ( I like a spoon of sugar in mine). I also bought a homemade croissant that they keep in a warmed glass case so you are able to choose which kind you'd like. The warm, flaky, buttery goodness went perfectly with my coffee and helped me get ready for my day of work. On another occasion I tried a bite of my friend's lemon loaf. It was moist and full of lemony deliciousness. They have a wide variety of pastries and desserts from cheesecake to giant peanut butter cookies. Be careful if you have a sweet tooth! They also have savory food for breakfast like bagels and egg dishes. Their prices are reasonable and you can definitely see why this local neighborhood coffee shop keeps it's customers coming back for more.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Super. Andre and Cynthia keep up a chill vibe :) Very comfy seating corners with plugpoints right behind. A great place to sit and work at, with Wifi. 
It's fun with the Muni/train passing by every now and then, grinding its wheels at the corner, leaning heavily on its side :)
Food things, especially that red velvet cake slice I am avoiding looks pretty sitting there under glass covers.
Old people walk in a lot, so it has a nice neighborly feel. Also school kids.
Good thing is a grocery shop is right opposite it so after you chill, you can buy your groceries and head home.
Wish they had a bigger selection of veg salads. Please expand - add a grilled veggies salad maybe, or kale-feta. The salad they do have is yum. The bread they give with the salads is fab.. fresh... (Made me break my no-bread vow).
author: Malvika B.

description:
Their coffees and teas are very good. For years I would come here in the late afternoon as a break from walking. The pastries look fresh and delicious.  
More recently however I have found that the café is overcrowded, and sometimes their music is too loud
author: Sheila F.

description:
Life is too short. 

Thanks to the surly, ungrateful, clearly unhappy chicks who now run this, Adam's local neighborhood cafe has lost it's charm. Today, (April 2nd, 2015) they were blaring Christmas music, as if to scare away customers. In an otherwise charming space, these employees have made a beautiful, restful neighborhood spot an unwelcome place to be, with their loud, obnoxious music and their shitty attitude towards longtime neighbors and anyone in general.

It's happened several visits over the last few years and my neighbors have said the same. 

The food is still good, but the atmosphere is toxic. Perhaps that explained why a once busy and popular place was now nearly empty at lunch hour.

Am done with Cafe XO.

Church and 30th used to be a very friendly to all Greek part of my SF youth. Adam's cafe was once Acropolis Travel agency. I regret that Adam has relegated his business to these cretins.
author: Lotion M.

description: Nice place, good coffee. Easy to access to buses (just right there). A wide collection of marvelous pastry.
author: Khuong T.

description: Really good customer service and food, love the banana bread!! Adam was really nice, very home feeling inside the cafe.
author: Jason M.

description: The coffee is okay.. Over priced for sure on almost almost everything. I bought a 10 dollar caesar salad, literally only romaine with powder cheese & croutons..  and  i am not impressed with anything.. Customer service is off.. I can't recommend anything. The owner or worker was questioning customers who places orders, that is a red flag.
author: Santoki A.

description: The espresso was fine,  I just don't like the layout of this cafe.  Everything seems so cramped-especially the ordering counter.  And, the empty tables need to cleared sooner so other customers can sit comfortably.
author: Thomas D.

description: Delicious cappuccino and welcoming classic Italian café ambiance! Outside tables look welcoming though bring a sweater because it's SF ;-)
author: Robert J.

description:
My boyfriend and I wanted to try a new cafe for our weekend morning coffee and unfortunately we stumbled upon Cafe XO. Ick...

The cashier cut off both of us when we were giving our order and snapped at me when I double-checked if she got my boyfriend's order (because she spoke over him and cut him off). When I ordered she did the same and before I could order my coffee she turned around, back to me, and started a conversation with another employee. It was nothing urgent, something inventory related for "this afternoon" but apparently warranted complete disregard for the customer standing in front of her.

Surprise, surprise my boyfriend's breakfast bagel was wrong. The coffee was crap, and there was a weird smell in the cafe. Won't be going back. There's plenty of other cafes in the area that can muster eye contact and a 'good morning' for customers.
author: Chanda G.

description: The best Spanakopita and Greek Moussaka in San Francisco! Adam, the owner, is from Greece, so everything is homemade and very Authentic!! The atmosphere is superb an very cozy. The staff are extremely friendly and attentive.
author: William H.

description: Delicious homemade baklava! Have had the regular and the pistachio and both were amazing!
author: Mio W.

description: Only minus 1 star because it's hella hot in here! Other than that $6.20 for a purity organic lemonade and slice of good ol apple pie! Hella good. Chill spot. There's only 1 guy up front working mainly and he is kicking ass multi-tasking! And also, yes, yes their apple pie is way better than Mission Pies. But. Most sf peeps already know that ;)
author: Syncere S.

description: It was 3:30 pm and the crew already started sweeping the floor and all around our table while speaking in their native language. We thought maybe they were closing, but they said not until 7pm.
author: Ben K.

description:
Maybe like 2.4 stars. Their location and convenience is the thing they have going for them. (A star for that) coffee is ok, croissants banana bread and other baked goods pretty tasty (two stars) but the service can be hit or miss. The sweet lady is always cheery and friendly (two stars). She can be overly chatty with her friends and then the line builds up and things slow.  But there's this other guy who's also there in the mornings and is a total grump with a lot of attitude. Talking about a middle aged eurotrashy douche trying to be young with overly gelled hair, tight tee shirt, gold chain etc. He thinks he's doing you a huge favor by taking your order. (Minus 2.6 or more) his attitude makes me regret coming in and supporting this local business. 
Initially, thought it was an off day for him, but no, he is consistently like that with me. 
Next time I'll just walk in and see who's at the register and keep walking if I see him there....For some reason I suspect he is the owner tho. So maybe I'll continue walking to Martha Bros. or to Bom Dia.
author: tee c.

description:
Looks like everyone's heard about the amazingly smooth Soy Lattes at Cafe XO - no need for sugar. When I was there this morning, 5 out of 6 people ordered soy coffees & I was no exception. 

Just the lightest sprinkle of cinnamon & I had a warm, velvety, creamy latte to welcome me to my day

Since I'm traveling this wknd, thought a nice sugary treat would be appropriate to pair w/ my coffee so I opted for Choc Chip Cookie..... was just a bit underdone which is exactly how I like them - delish!

Also got their homemade BANANA-BREAD Bread Pudding served in muffin wraps - super moist & smhooshable....YES!  Banana Bread made into a Bread Pudding!  It was delightful & worth a special trip just for that!
author: Adrienne G.

description: I've visited this cafe lots over the past years, since it's so convenient to Noe Rec Center. It's in a great location and has a lovely ambiance, but I just had to post a review since I cannot get over the lousy service. I can accept mediocre service if prices are low, but prices here are quite high ($5 for a hot tea if you drink it inside, for instance). The staff always seem disinterested or even annoyed when asked questions. Unfortunately, I won't be returning there. I'll walk a little further up Church to Martha's next time! More affordable and much better service!
author: Maria V.

description:
An unfriendly owner who refused to honor my 2 for 1 voucher that I had just printed from the Internet. A surprising attitude for a person in this type of business.

The food was barely edible. The spanokopita was dry and tasteless and the accompanying salad did not have enough dressing.

All in all not a good experience. I will never go back.
author: Liz N.

description: I have to start my review with a Spanish phrase: "Este sitio está de Puta Madre". The coffee was meticulously prepared and it was exquisite. My friend had the breakfast special and nothing was left on his plate. I had the Belgian waffle and it was delicious, as I was eating I saw one of their breakfast burritos and got really interested, OMG I'm so glad I ordered one, it must be one of the best breakfast burritos I ever had, and I'm from New Mexico. The food, although rich in flavor, is not heavy on the stomach. This will be a must visit again if I return to San Francisco!
author: Rafael H.

description:
I love Cafe XO!

Great coffee, huge selection of pastries and other foods, and a super warm atmosphere.

My favorite place to chill out on a sunny weekend day.

Nicest & friendliest staff too! Adam, the owner, has a contagiously awesome attitude every time.
author: Teiki K.

description: Very rude Latino guy's service today pushed me away from this place. I think is ridiculous to charge special smoothie price $7 and ask to charge extra $1.25 for one banana!!! Plus, friend of mine complaint that ppl behind the counter turn off wifi if you don't buy anything. Be aware of it.
author: Marina D.

description: This place is beautifully!! I wish they open more stores. I stop going to Starbucks endless I have too. They have deserts drinks that no one else has.
author: tung t.

description:
Super cute place, with hardworking staff that aims to please.  Since this place is in my neighborhood - I was looking forward to being a regular and frequenting this spot.  

Unfortunately this place falls short with not only the coffee, which is OK - but the espresso definitely leaves a lot to be desired.  On top of that the prices are very unreasonably high.

However where they do shine are the homemade croissants and their breakfast sandwiches which are very delicious and made to order. 

Another note, if you are going here to do work or read, I recommend going elsewhere.  Hearing Celion Dion is one thing, but hearing a slew of really terrible sappy music, I hoped in my life I would never hear again - has caused me to walk out of this place.  It was too loud and borderline unbearable.

Bottom line: I really wanted to love this place, but for the price and the mediocre coffee, I'll walk that extra mile elsewhere.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Cute little coffee shop on the corner of 30th and Church. It gets busy in the mornings, probably because there is only one person behind the counter handling everything. She works hard to get everybody's order right and in a timely fashion.

They also have pastries in a self-serve warmer -- I like that feature. The spanakopita and moussaka were very good. I know, weird choices for breakfast, but they looked good through the viewing window, so we had to try it.

My friend loved her chai tea latte...she came back multiple times to this place to get it. I got the mocha and wasn't impressed. It was very powdery and tasted artificial. Bleh...it left something to be desired.

I believe this place takes card, but there is a $5 minimum.
author: Maki K.

description: A very local feel, with super friendly staff and very fresh pastries and food! They have fast wifi and indoor and outdoor seating.
author: Aljosha N.

description: Decent place, nothing special but they have a good selection of pastries and the coffee is good. Only a few seats, more like a grab n go place.
author: Paloma M.

description:
XO is one of my most treasured little neighborhood spots.  Their coffee is wonderful, the pastries are absolutely delicious (try the home made Baklava.  It is OMG good), and the OWNER is a dream boat - gorgeous, sweet, and greek.  Oh, my.  Those arms :)

Oh yeah, XO Cafe.  Yes, this place is wonderful :).  The inside is very adorable: tables and chairs line the walls with a cream/sugar area in the center.  There are also tables outside if you want to enjoy the SF sun in Noe Valley.  

Highly recommend this place!  :)
author: Michael D.

description:
I went in so happy and started getting excited as I strolled by all the beautiful cakes and cookies on the way to the cash register. I ordered a decaf coffee, and gave them my cup ( I hate wasting paper cups) which they used. Cool. The lady behind the counter was very friendly. 

So I decided to treat myself to an apricot rugelach which from afar looked great (I wasn't wearing my glasses). Close up, it was small and hard as a rock; it looked like it came from a processed box you would buy from a grocery store- not homemade. Ugh. And to boot, it was $2.00!! 

 I then realized I needed a $5 minimum to use my card and I only had $3.50 so far. Okay, so instead of just giving them 50 cents to bypass the minimum I then ordered a chocolate covered biscotti-- it was dinner time after all and it looked presentable enough. 

I sat outside and ate the rugulach and drank my coffee. Coffee was very nice but the rugalach was hard to bite into & overall 
I didn't enjoy the mastication process at all.    

Biscotti was hard as well but I let it slide since it was a biscotti and was covered in chocolate ;-)

I loved sitting outside but eventually went inside because it was getting cold. Aside from the prices, and the rugulach, I enjoyed the time I spent there reading my book. I'd go back.
author: Roya D.

description:
Really cozy cafe, but I wouldn't come here for the coffee. 

This little corner cafe has outstanding atmosphere with a great selection of pastries and snacks and a modest menu of breakfast and lunch. I came here once before, for lunch, but went somewhere else because nothing on the menu particularly struck my fancy that day. However, a couple days later I came back for breakfast and had a fruit & yogurt parfait and a cappuccino.

The parfait was delicious. Plenty of fruit and yogurt and artfully presented in a large glass goblet with a tiny bit of whipped cream on top. It was definitely big enough to hit the hungry empty spot in my stomach that morning.

The cappuccino on the other hand was flat and unhappy. What vexed me was that they have really fancy bowls for the parfait but served the cappuccino in a paper cup. I would have expected at least a plain ceramic cup for a cozy little cafe like this. It just seemed like a strange juxtaposition compared to everything else; almost as if the espresso part of the picture was an after thought. However, I could have easily looked past this if the cappuccino itself was well made. Sadly the contents of the cup were as lazy and sad as the paper cup. The foam quickly went flat and the rest of the drink was just so-so.

This little cafe has a lot going for it and if they would simply invest in some ceramic cups and proper training for their baristas it would easily be a top notch espresso bar.
author: Jeremy G.

description: There was a broken piece of a ceramic plate in my boyfriend's bagel sandwich, which cracked his tooth. This place isn't nearly good enough to risk eating a plate.
author: Angelica R.

description: Recently on a mid afternoon visit, experience less than. Pricing was not on their chalkboard so asked barrister mocha cost ~ quite surly reply " it depends on size!" Ordered and got size large plus 1 cookie...OUCH $7.00. Not worth the price
author: Jas S.

description: Great food, great service.  Wonderful homemade cookies and delicious waffles all served in a pleasant neighborhood atmosphere.
author: Tony V.

description: Latte was thin, flat screen tv playing college football, top 40 music, some cushioned seating. Eclectic vibes tho, pretty gaudy souvenirs from around the world decorate the place. Markedly different atmosphere from most sf cafes, but overall an enjoyable place to get off the hip and artisanal path, while sacrificing quality.
author: Jordan S.

description: I like this place. Their croissants are excellent and most things I've had are good. What I don't like is the customer service. I ordered a couple of iced drinks and was given hot ones. When I explained that I had ordered iced drinks they simply poured out some of the drink and put some ice in. When I explained again what I had ordered the woman said I ordered it hot which simply wasn't true and she wasn't apologetic or remotely responsive about it. I just left and didn't get any coffee and she didn't seem to care.
author: Ben L.

description: Great coffee, pastries and ambience! Been going here for 6+ years and have been thrilled with experience every time.
author: Rosanna L.

description: Nice little cafe in the city to get breakfast and read the papers before you head to work, nice selection, and friendly staff ... Highly recommended ..
author: Omar J.

description:
The service needed to improve.  

The environment was inspiring, well-decorated. The music selection was also a good mix, with pop.
author: J L.

description: I love going to this cafe. The people who work here are always so friendly and kind. The baked goods are the bomb, those mini-cinnamon roles are like little bites of heaven.
author: D M.

description: Love this place. Awesome french roast coffee and great scones...I try to go most days that I'm in town. Andreas and Betty are super sweet to our dog too (he drags us in for treats half the time). So lucky to have this place on our block.
author: Josh L.

description: This is a neighborhood gem. They pack so many delicious pastries into a small little cafe. But they somehow score well on quality too. Everything is delicious. Lots of good food. Charming setting. A great place to grab coffee and a treat before getting on the 24 or the J Church.
author: Maxwell W.

description: I just really wish the coffee here was good. It always tastes burnt. I don't know if it's because they don't clean the machines thoroughly, or if it's the brand of coffee they use. I would love to come here every day but I JUST CAN'T DO IT. :-(
author: Brooke H.

description:
Cafe XO is so wonderful, cozy, and warm! I could bring a blanket and just snuggle up here with a book all day! 

Stumbling in on a [very] rainy afternoon, I felt like Alice through the looking glass. With a few steps, my world had transformed from a dreary wet Sunday to wooden interior with cute little art, delicious homemade croissants and pastries in a heated self-serve case, sumptuous pies, delectable cakes, and interesting cookies. 

I got the lemon meringue pie, a croissant, and a coffee. The lemon pie was the perfect balanace of tart custard and soft airy meringue. The croissant was very very buttery and flaky, and the coffee was solid. They had an immpressive coffee stand that greeted it cusomters and everyone was very friends. 

An absolutely delicious experience that I cannot wait to repeat.
author: Sue Y.

description:
Cafe XO is a good, honest coffee shop.  It reflects the attitude and ethic of the "Upper Noe" neighborhood, sleepier and more blue collar than Noe proper along 24th Street. Like the other shops and restaurants at the corner of Church and 30th, XO surprises you with the quality of its offerings, in this case, solid coffee and great baked goods. The decor and ambiance isn't for everyone, and I suppose that even after years of coming here, it still isn't for me. I like coffee shops that are stripped down, wooden, and modern. Influenced by its owners, XO is more European and baroque.
  True to the neighborhood, service is warm and unassuming. It's not so much a response to San Francisco's ice cold hipsterista movement as much a parallel world where Ritual, Four Barrel and Blue Bottle don't exist. 

It's probably not worth a dedicated trip from outside the neighborhood, particularly since the only forms of public transportation that will get you here are the No. 24 bus and the dreaded J-Church. However, for those with an early reservation to La Ciccia, Pomelo or Tataki South, XO is a solid, underappreciated place to grab a coffee.
author: Julio A.

description: I agree with other posts about their coffee, it seemed a little on the weak side. Their pastry selection though was on point.
author: John G.

description: Dropped into the cafe after visiting friends in Noe Valley.  I needed to check email and they have WiFi and comfortable seating and well lit areas.  Order up Spanakopita.  It came with green salad and served warm.  The spanakopita was flavorable and the crust very light and flakey.  Just what I wanted for a quick bite.  When ever I am in the neighborhood, it will be the place that I will drop by for coffee and a bite to eat.
author: Dave F.

description:
Seems I'm going to have a new addiction: Cafe XO's Homemade Spanakopita... flaky, fresh, delicious. It's better than my Mom's, but don't tell her that.
Asked the owner if it was tiropita (or is it spelled tyropita?) Who cares. If it was, I would have likely bought the remaining of the tray. That stuff is why I work out.
Ya, I think I need to marry a Greek woman yet I'm very straight. haha.
Just love authenticity in people & what I choose to grub on. 

This place rocks and gets 6 stars.
author: Athena S.

description: Great pastries.  Decent coffee and tea.  Excessively high prices.  'nuff said.
author: Eric G.

description: I bought one slice of the "better" velvet cake in the case rather than the one top of the counter. To my dismay and shear disgust, the velvet cake was devoured by green hills of mold inside. From the case, I could only see the coat of frost. Once I took it out of the bag and popped the lid open, the exterior looked a bit dry and stale, only after I pierced it with my forked, the mass bumps of green mold was shocking.  It was such that I was confused that I was looking at a miniature archetype of a landscape.  There was a multi-layered city of green furry mold.
author: Suzanne H.

description: This is our favorite place to stop in for a cookie after school. My kids call it "the cookie store."
author: Kristen H.

description:
Very friendly staff and really good coffee. Nice location and cute interior decor. Pastries are also very tasty.

My one issue is that everything is over priced.
author: Melissa O.

description: I have been coming here since 2003. Had my first chai date with my now wife here, shared meals, coffee, good times and of course incredible chai. I love the owner and staff who have always treated us like family. Still wish we lived around the corner to be able to come here everyday...
author: Max E.

description:
A little farther away from the house than two other coffee places, but worth a stop now and then.  

After dropping off some mail, I decided to walk around a bit and found my way here.  Located near a transportation hub with a streetcar, it looks to get a lot of business.  I think many of the morning employees grab some coffee, etc before hoping on the shuttle to either Genentech or Google as both stop nearby.

The coffee was just about as good as I can get elsewhere nearby, and the pastries were warm, available from the counter.  A lot of other things are available, like sandwiches, salads.

Another place to add to my list in my neighborhood to check out in more detail.
author: Michael M.

description: Stopped in for a Chai Latte before heading to Upper Noe Rec Center. I specifically asked for a Iced Chai Latte. When receiving my drink, the "Barista" calls it out as a Iced Chai. I knew when grabbing it, it was way too dark for a Chai but I stayed optimistic. I out my usual Add-Ins and took a sip. ICED COFFEE. I brought it right back and asked politely if it was an Iced Chai. He replied Yes and asked if he could remake it because it was an Iced Coffee. He grabbed it without any apology. He began to make my Iced Chai and started slamming the fridge doors and having an attitude. He didn't say anything after it was done and just left it on the counter. I grabbed it and said THANK YOU SO MUCH and he sad sarcastically mmhmm. Now it's not my fault you messed my drink. I was very polite to start with and you should be great full I'm supporting your local business rather than going to Starbucks or Petes where I can get exactly what I order the first time! NOT COMING BACK DUE TO THE BAD SERVICE FROM THE MALE "BARISTA"
author: Nicko M.

description: Cute cafe, yummy bagel with lots of cream cheese and cucumbers. The coffee was good too! Seems like a cute place to hang out inside and outside.
author: Karen T.

description: Homemade croissants kept warm in a little self serve warmer. and yummy. Double espresso was just right! fancy to-go cups a little over-overboard.
author: Coco J.

description:
la la la

Anything for a neighborhood cafe joint that reminds me of the little tea tents that may have been erected during the Victorian days replete with cute outdoor furniture and charming accoutrements that detract from the modernity hustling away on rails right outside.

I stepped in because my date was putting our names down for brunch at Toast down the street and my obvious caffeine addiction had already kicked in: meaning I was not up to my spastic verbal self.

The staff are pretty laid back and especially nice if they personally know you.  An extra star for their obvious love for pups of the day since they let dogs on the outdoor bench as well as a watering bowl.  

My latte was extra hot, just like I ordered and ready to go.  Slightly expensive, but what does one expect?  If you can afford to live in Noe Valley, then expect a slightly higher tab.  I've already gotten use to it   :(
author: Miika M.

description:
I shed a tear when I think of Cafe XO, as it was a block from our apartment in Noe Valley. I probably spent more time here than I did at home, mostly due to grad school and constant homework. 

If one were on a quest for the BEST crossiant around, XO has it- crispy, buttery and fluffy-soft on the inside. There is a cute little nook in the back as well, which is perfect for studying and cramming. My now-husband also proposed to me here so it holds a special place in my heart for that reason. The location is perfect-- it is right on the corner of Church and 30th so you will hear the hum of the train while sipping your perfect espresso. If you are looking for a place to have a perfectly lazy Saturday morning with a book, or a loved one, check it out!
author: Melissa S.

description:
I don't have much to say here, except that the people who run the place clearly care about what they do, and it shows.

I remember seeing the one of the owners at Safeway with a shopping cart filled with maybe 30 gallons of milk. We chatted a bit, and he explained to me that Safeway just has the best milk for frothing, no other milk does the trick, even Whole Foods. I don't know why that sticks with me, maybe that he doesn't send someone else to fetch the milk / doesn't get it delivered. Or that he bothered to test all local milks to find the best froth.

Even if you don't indulge in all the amazing baked goods they have, the smell of all that is a pleasant greeting to the shop. 

I just feel really lucky to have this place around the corner from where I live.
author: Ches W.

description: This part of Noe Valley deserves a great coffee shop and Cafe XO is not it.
author: Elizabeth A.

description: I used to live across the street here 3 years ago and I tried to give this place a chance many times but it always felt very mediocre and generally the people who work there are unfriendly.  Today I was there with my brother-in-law and I saw a tall man (who I think is the owner - Italian looking guy) blows his nose three times immediately after we put in order.  He looked kind of sick since he was sniffling a lot. I assumed he was going to wash his hands before serving us - but lo and behold - he grabbed our coffee glasses and touched the rims (everyone knows you grab by the glass, you don't touch the rim where someone drinks from) and touch food and serve it to us.  I threw some of my stuff away after seeing the man act like a pig and touch our food that way but my brother-in-law took a risk.  DISGUSTING!
author: Sasha B.

description: Just moved into the neighborhood but knew there had to be a coffee spot on Church because it seems to have everything! Went walking toward Church and was happy to find a cafe right on the corner of Church and 30th only a couple blocks from my house. The cashier/barista was very friendly and charismatic. Not a huge/diverse menu for coffee but had all the basics and was delicious. Also had a lot of food choices which will be good to remember next time i need breakfast on the go.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
I got an overpriced stale ass bagel here. I don't even know if it was toasted or not, it was that stale. Coffee was no bueno either. 

Methinks not.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Celine Dion's "My Heart Will Go On"? Opera remix of "Don't Cry for Me, Argentina"? Madonna's "Like A Virgin"? Seriously, XO?

If the music makes it impossible to work, at least it keeps the hipsters out. And I don't want those skinny bastards finding out about my powdery Greek wedding cookies or my frothy, foamy chais!
author: Lily J.

description:
update:  10/30/10

I just finished what is arguably the best pumpkin-cheesecake I've eaten in SF.  The in-house pastries and desserts are delicious!   

I wish someone would hurry up and invent a teleportation machine, mass produce it, and give me one for Christmas.  Then I'd be able to enjoy Cafe XO's pastries as soon as I wake up, without having to put on any clothes and leave the house.  

I wish they had a Facebook page...
author: Antonio L.

description:
Does the woman behind the counter really need to be loudly gabbing away on her cell phone as she makes the latte?  Maybe that has something to do with me being served the wrong cup of joe.  

If the staff can be whipped into shape, this place has real potential.  Luscious-looking pastries and nice stylish atmosphere make me want to give this place a second chance.  Let's just hope the barista runs out of minutes on her cell phone plan.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I'm not sure why this wouldn't be 5 star, except is a bit hot without AC. 
Service was great - friendly, efficient and fast. 
Food was awesome - the tomato and goat cheese quiche is one of the best things I have ever eaten. Loaded with goat cheese. 
Tremendous selection of pastries, salads, sandwiches, coffee, tea and Odwalla products. 
Decadent hunks of red velvet cake, chocolate dipped macaroons, and thick slices of pound cake.  I fell in love with the "healthy nut cookie", although I expect very little is "healthy" about it.
author: Lindsey D.

description: This place has everything. Nice folks, great coffee and scrumptious food not to mention a plethora of sweeties. Order a sandwich and be prepared to be full. Order a beverage and you can get it in giant bowl just the way a grandma who has no mugs would do. I have spend many a fine afternoon working in this cozy well lit cafe. Come join me and get ready for bliss.
author: Beaufort K.

description: I love this cafe! I must admit I am no coffee gourmet and I drink decaf whenever possible but I love the food and pastries here. They bake fresh muffins and have great lunch. I especially like their salads and sandwiches - they give pretty large portions too. I can't say they are particularly friendly here but I go there for the nice atmosphere and the yummy food. It's a nice place to sit and do some work while I eat lunch.
author: Laura K.

description:
Wonderful place.  Great atmosphere, very cozy.  Good pastries, good coffee, and even has a breakfast menu with bagels, waffles, potatoes etc.  It's one of those places that makes you feel good on a weekend morning.  Everybody was in a good mood and it has that neighborhood feel of a European cafe.

Not sure how to describe it, just a great energy.
author: Johny X.

description:
First time here today and am in love with the place! I didn't try any food, but the coffee was delicious and the atmosphere was awesome. Will definitely come back to try the delicious homemade goodness. 

BIG PLUS: There's a changing table in the bathroom!!! :) I am a mom and believe that there should be one required in EVERY bathroom....like ADA requirements.
author: Courtney B.

description: Food seems hit or miss. So does the service. For example, I ordered a PANINO and the guy said, "a PANINI." I said, no, that's plural; he basically grumbled. The panino turned out to be grilled cheese on regular bread--nothing special and just average. I wanted to like this place more, given the cute atmosphere and location, but alas...mediocrity.
author: Hella Stella Y.

description:
Go! It's pleasant! Especially when it is part sunny and slightly cool and you need to work (on a Saturday)... 

The person behind the counter is very sweet. 
The pastries behind the counter are very sweet. (Maybe too sweet but I still enjoyed my chocolate/almond horn).

Not so sweet: the espresso. I'll have another one in a bit and report back if it turns out that the first one was just a case of bad luck.

Idea for the perfect day: walk slowly to XO. chat with pal while having tea and cookie. keep on doing that until you are about to faint from the desire for food and then cross the street to La Ciccia!
author: tal n.

description:
If you love going to a nice cozy coffee shop and quietly working or reading...this is not the place to go.  This place is LOUD.  And I'm not even talking about the rumble of the passing J-Church or the whirring of the milk steamer.

I'm referring to the customers.  For whatever reason, the customers here think it is perfectly acceptable to shout from one end of the cafe to their friends at the other end, where screaming children are a regular occurrance, where the finer art of talking quietly on your cell phone or to your tablemate is lost.  The tables fill up frequently and the customers feel to need to raise their own voices in order to be heard over the cacaphony surrounding them.

The decor is lovely and sophisticated.  I wish the clientele were as well.
author: David O.

description:
I love the ambiance here, very European with marble bistro tables, dark wood floors, nice huge windows for natural light. The drip coffee is delicious, and I like it strong. I'm surprised about the bad reviews but maybe they took it to heart.

Lots of pastry, at good prices, with a smattering of Greek baklava and other Greek food, as the owner is Greek. 

Definitely a good place to work if you're not looking for a trendster scene.
author: Susie W.

description: Adamand his stuff is very nice, They have a really europian coffe and home made pastries are frash and yammy. Planty of seet area inside and outside. it is nice that they have caffe is big and cpaces
author: Yevgeny D.

description: Not great, not bad, convenient location. Excellent milkshakes.
author: Brian O.

description:
I live a block and a half away, and this is why I come to this cafe, because its close & because it has wifi. This cafe is cute but I wish the employees and owner (who is frequently there as cashier/barista) were more friendly and less abrasive. Employees usually distracted or on their cell phones.
Its in a great corner location with people, automobile and nearby business watching galore. Every time I am in here there are nannies/moms with their babies/children in strollers showing that Noe Valley is truly the family district.

Bathroom: Needs a little updating and needs to be clean more often.
Condiments: Need to be tidied and filled rigorously.
Coffee Quality: Too expensive for okay coffee. I only drink coffee here when I haven't any time to get anything else. oh and If you drink your coffee there in a ceramic/porcelain cup they will refill it for free (with mediocre coffee, but hey, its free).
Credit Cards: Will only accept if over a certain amount of $$.
author: Cub H.

description: Fussy over priced cafe decorated for a grandmother.
author: Mark C.

description:
I love the fact that this is a one minute walk from my place. I'm definitely a fan and just love the coziness of the place.

This is one of my favorite coffee shops in the city.

Cafe Mocha is a must when you come here.
author: Eric A.

description: It's a quaint cute little cafe until you walk in and encounter Jose who runs the front. He's always on edge, unable to happily run the front with composure. The coffees not too great either. A few good pastries but that's about it. I think it gets foot traffic because it's convenient but honestly the service sucks. Not sure the owner cares about the service his community is receiving at his cafe. You should be able to go and have a relaxing time and be greeted with a smile. Follow some footsteps of Starbucks. Today Jose told me that 'MONEY IS MONEY' when he gave me $2.25 in change back. I wasn't happy about that and that's why I'm here. He also bit at the girl in front of me because she wasn't paying attention. She began to order and he told her to wait because he was clearly busy trying to count all the change he was handing back to me. She was not impressed but I'm sure she won't be writing about it. Looks like she had bigger problems. He should really practice kindness. I think he just hates his job and by each encounter and watching him, he should be replaced by someone who values the people who walk in the door and loves their job. The girl making the coffee also looks like she's barely getting by. Miserable employees.
author: Sunkissed C.

description:
Cafe XO has become 'my' coffee shop.  It's right around the corner from my house, the staff is always very friendly and warm and they have free wi-fi.  I usually stop in to work on the computer and grab a latte.  Alan, the owner is great at recognizing frequent customers and the staff always gives fantastic customer service. 

Great coffee.
Excellent soy lattes.
Fantastic selection of fresh pastries.
They accept credit cards!

Great place!
author: Rachael B.

description:
I'm still a fan. It's a cozy place and the food has always been pretty good. My biggest complaint really is the coffee. (I'd give the coffee 2 stars.) I'd give this place seven stars if they would start brewing coffee from one of our local roasters (Ritual? Four Barrel? Sightglass?) Any one will do. 

Alas, Noe Valley is a bit of a wasteland for coffee. Cafe Bello in Glen Park or Ritual in Mission are the only real choices for coffee lovers... And those are both a bit of a hike for me. So, come on XO, step up your game! Earn those stars. (Please?)
author: Jason Y.

description:
nice atmosphere, nice menu, nice lettuce in my salad. 
oh wait, scratch that last one. they forgot to wash it. dirt/mud kind of stands out among cesar dressing and i don't recall cesar dressing being gritty other times i've had it.
author: Sam B.

description:
Though it gets decent marks for charm, I can't recommend this place. Stopped by for a quick bagel sandwich and latte to go and was stunned by:

1) the service. Our rather simple order was mishandled and forgotten. I had to remind them to make my sandwich and then they brought it out without the egg I requested. When I told them I asked for egg, the cashier said she didn't charge me for egg, but then checked the tape and realized that she did. Which leads to...  
2) the prices. 8 bucks for a bagel with egg and ham--are you kidding me?
3) the coffee. Terrible. Burned. Ick. I wouldn't call myself a coffee snob, but this stuff was not drinkable; even after applying a last-resort dose of sugar. 

I didn't sample any of the pastries, but I won't be returning to give them a try. There are plenty of other more deserving places.
author: Chris O.

description:
WAY to expensive, but they make a good Chai lattte. 

Often I'll come here after putting my name on the wait list for brunch at Toast Eatery a block away.

I don't know why it's listed as in Glen Park, though. I'd definitely call Church and 30th Noe Valley.
author: Elena C.

description:
For a quick lunch, I usually hit this spot. It's not always busy and when it is, the service is fast and always with a smile! Today i wasn't in the mood to be adventurous so I had the BLT on wheat. It was pretty good and fresh, the same thing I could make at home. Unlike most places there were 5+ strips of bacon on there and not a meager strip or two. It came with a salad and orange slices on the side to compliment the sandwich. Most of the sandwiches are under $10 so you cant beat that. Jars of brownies, macaroons, biscotti and a display case with pastries. Oh and trays of fresh muffins every morning! Huge cakes, quiche and tiramisu all tempting you. Bronze buckets of water, pellegrino, orangina, snapple and oj and apple juice. For a morning pick-me-up, they've got my white mocha with soy. 

Inside it's very cozy and inviting. Warm terra cotta walls with cloth and leather chairs. Round marble tables for two. There's free wifi so you can surf and eat.
author: Lola L.

description: Today is my first visit to Cafe XO.  Like it a lot.  Free Wifi, nice and cozy atmosphere.  Neighborhood is great as far as I can tell.  If I'm in the city and need a nice place to eat and work, I'll be back!
author: Eddy B.

description:
Spotted in my Entertainment (2-for-1) book, I decided to give this cafe a try and I'm glad I did. The people behind the counter were helpful and friendly, and the menu is pleasantly diverse (soups, sandwiches, desserts, and lots of coffees and teas). Comfy chairs and free wi-fi made it even better.

My Cafe Milan (mocha with orange syrup) was quite tasty and not too sweet. My sandwich (pastrami) was okay, but nothing to write home about. I asked for a panini, expecting a grilled 'n' crispy delight, but it was basically just a regular sandwich.

So I'd suggest coming here and lingering over some cups of fine coffee and tea, perhaps sampling a dessert, but I don't think the sandwiches are worth the price.
author: Adam L.

description:
I have never been served a piece of Pumpkin Chocolate bread that was so enormous. It was literally enough for 3 in all its chewy goodness. I split it with my friend and still could not finish it. 

I liked the environment. It seems like the perfect little neighborhood coffee shop. But with exceptionally large portions of Pumpkin Chocolate bread.

If I lived near here I would spend far too much time here eating nothing but enormous pieces of Pumpkin Chocolate bread.
author: Marz W.

description:
I wish I could give XO more stars. As I wrote before, nice ambiance, and the service is friendly. My sandwich was so so, though the salad on the side was a nice addition. Coffee was fine too. But negative marks for spotty wifi, lack of honey (who doesn't carry honey?), and the kicker, charging $0.75 for flavored syrup. I think that is excessive, and tend to yelp down because of it.

Not the worst place to end up, but one can do better (try Nervous Dog down the street).
author: Jason B.

description:
I am actually embarrassed that I had never been here before. I will blame my mother. Partially because I'm used to and it rarely steers me wrong. And partially because when I am willing to eat at coffee shops, my mother makes a face and says "I want REAL food."

So I finally convinced her to eat here because we were in a rush to go shoe shopping for THE wedding. That motivated her. It was gorgeous outside and all the windows and the door were open. We ordered espresso drinks and bagels with lox and all the fixin's.

By the end of the day, she was talking more about Cafe XO than the shoes. Trust me, this is stop-the-press news. We just loved the atmosphere, the people, the lox, the coffee and the adorable red mugs the coffee was served in. Oh, and I drooled over the waffle that walked by me that was beautifully covered in strawberries and bananas. (And I don't even like bananas!)
author: Maya S.

description: Nice people work here. Tables are not always clean, but just ask and they will clean it. THEY HAVE WONDERFUL COOKIES!
author: MT Y.

description:
After reading other reviews I would like to try some of the homemade pastries...however, I dropped by yesterday for a soy mocha, a soy latte, and two egg/bagel sandwiches.

It was $22! Seriously?! 

The mocha tasted like it came from a mix and the latte wasn't even drinkable. And the bagels were pretty blah.
author: Michelle V.

description:
Cafe XO - with the lush red walls, plush chairs in the back, decent drip coffee but even better espresso drinks, etc. etc. etc.  All in all a nice (perhaps even romantic) place to go get a cup o' joe).......

.....until the damn J-Church squeals around the corner.  My goodness, it's loud -- even with headphones on and music blaring.  I think Muni has tried recently to address this issue, but that's definitely the one thing that kept this place from becoming my "office away from my home office."

Otherwise, good coffee, good eats (try the croissant egg sandwich), and free WiFi (or at least it used to be free).
author: hillary h.

description:
FINALLY made it to this place....and I'm glad I did.

Plusses: Nice atmosphere, yummy lunches (my friend ordered a BLT and I got the chicken gyros sandwich),  good treats (though no cupcakes - boo hoo), decent coffee, nice selection of armchairs and tables for sitting with your laptop to get work done.

Minuses: You only get a ceramic mug if you order a MEDIUM beverage, otherwise you will get a paper cup.  And the bathroom light is on an automatic timer, so you may find yourself sitting on the toilet in the dark (I know I did)!
author: Jane A.

description:
Though a bit on the small side when compared to the big chain coffee houses or the out of the way coffee houses, XO is a wonderful gem in the upper Noe area.  I suspect the smaller size has something to do with the odd comments about service-- they have avoided the "Order Here" and "Pick Up Here" signage!

Adam (the owner) is so nice to everyone he encounters and regularly engages children with a free cookie or my dog with a carrot (who knew).  The coffee is great, the pastries fresh and their yogurt/granola is my favorite!     How ANYONE could have given this anything less than 3 stars is beyond me unless they just go through life with a chip on their shoulder!
author: Michael M.

description:
This is a great spot in Noe. I think it's probably the best, hang-out and get something done place around. There are a few others in the 'hood, but a lot of them fall short of providing a friendly staff, decent seating, and more than crappy snacks. XO actually has real food that actually pretty good for Cafe food standards.

Needs: better chairs (comfortable, but not great), more power outlet for laptops, stay open later in to the evening.
author: Dan M.

description:
Nice place to kick back with free wifi!  Love the German Chco Cake with whipped cream!!!!  Nice if they stayed open later.

Update 10/06/09:  Carrot cake is my new favorite!!  And the Soy Latte was great too!!!  Great place to enjoy with a friend!!!  Get one of the tables with the cozy chairs and pillows!!!
author: Ray Y.

description:
I love this European style cafe.  I live in Eureka Valley but it's worth the trip when I have the time.  They've made some recent changes I really like.  The brewed coffee used to taste burnt sometimes in the afternoon. I see they've changed to thermal instead of heated urns. I haven't had the burnt taste for a while.   I love the polenta muffins. My only complain is that they don't have them everyday!  The creamy rice pudding is perfect- not too sweet.  

They have the current and last few days of the NY TImes and Wall St Journal kept on newspaper canes just like in Paris or Barcelona.  I love to sit and catch up on the news.  The croissants are 5 star and as good as any I've had in Paris.  The brewed coffee is a solid 4 star.  The latte foam is sometimes hit or miss but lately more a hit. I think they are now using higher quality organic milk.  A while ago I sent a latte back because of weak foam.  The y re-did it and it came back perfect.  
With the changes this place earns 5 stars in my book.
author: jake O.

description: Favorite neighborhood hangout for getting work done. Good coffee, great homemade croissants, and love the staff!
author: Ana M.

description:
My first experience here was great!  Last Saturday was a picturesque day, and I got to spend the majority of the afternoon in comfy spot in the window of XO.  They had the door open, breeze blowing in; wonderful.

All I had the whole 3 hours I was there was an ice latte, which was great!  But some of the food plates people were getting looked delicious.  Next time I will try some.  

Although it's small, it wasn't too packed.  I got a great big padded chair by the door that was awesome because I got to sit in the sun light.  

The wireless needs a key, which is just the telephone number for the cafe.
author: Levi B.

description:
For me, a coffee shop is a place to read, chat, and feel comfortable like it's my own personal office. Cafe XO has become a frequent destination. Located on 30th and Church, XO is a quiet coffee shop, and a perfect destination for a cold rainy day. With a fireplace in the back, surrounded by comfy love seats, XO is a warm and friendly place to sit back, read, and enjoy a latte. 

XO lacks several outlets, which can be a problem when trying to work on a laptop, but usually, the place is not packed and so it's not an issue.

SFCritic
author: David J.

description:
Living in outer Noe Valley- Cafe XO is convenient for us. But thats about it.  Walked over there this morning and ordered the following:
Spinach Quiche- crust not cooked, WAY too much feta, eggs overdone.
Pumpkin Choc. Bread- at least a week old, dry, crumbly, no flavor.
Bagel w/ cream cheese & tomato- bagel not even warm, let alone toasted, not ripe tomato, and because they were out of Lox, I was stuck w/ Lox flavored cream cheese- gross.

Service is a mess- you don't even know where to order-where to wait- where to pick up..  This wasn't my first visit, but definitely will be my last. The only thing worthwhile was the 3-block walk.
author: Jeff L.

description:
I'm not a coffee aficionado or a foodie.  I just want a cafe that's quiet, where you can get a seat at off times (unlike Castro Starbuck's), where the coffee doesn't suck (unlike Castro Peet's - or any Peet's for that matter), and, sorry to say, where you don't have to worry about really really really strange probably homeless, mentally ill, dirty people hanging about (unlike Castro Peet's and Starbucks, Noe Valley Starbucks, and yes even on occasion Martha & Bros on Church).

So far Cafe X O has vaulted this bar admirably.  The customer service has been fine for me - the two shorter Spanish-speaking ladies are great.  And yes it is a mystery where your coffee/food will appear, but I've never been yelled at.  The coffee is definitely better than Starbuck's and Peet's (not saying much I know).  I'll definitely keep this place in my rotation.
author: Toby V.

description:
One of the best local neighbourhood cafes in sf.
A place where they know you coffee and you.
Love this place
The bread and butter muffins are amazing.
Gold
author: Nathan H.

description:
This is not my usual neighborhood ( I live in Daly City ) but I went in 
today to see friends who were visiting from Orange County. The 
grandma in the group used to work at the produce market across the 
street and it was a warm reunion for our enclave. I spent a good 15 
minutes perusing the menu and ogling the fabulous desserts, finally 
choosing a latte and chocolate cheesecake ( my friend was paying ). 
Had I been alone, I would have gone berserk and indulged in far more 
of their tempting offerings ( especially on the dessert menu ). 

The place is a bit small and the tables are as well - so there wouldn't 
have been enough room for the feast I was contemplating ( just as well ). I didn't go into the back area which was full but looked quite comfy with sofas and folks relaxed with their newspapers and treats. They looked like they were ensconced for the day! 

Parking is a bear - I made several trips around the block before a 
space opened up right in front. I finished one novena as I made the 
last turn.
author: Carmen H.

description: The younger, bald guy who works behind the counter is very rude.  I stopped by to get something really quick to go and my dog barked outside and he gave me some serious attitude about my dogs barking.  You think that having a dog bowl and leash tie off means they are dog friendly, but they are not.  On top of it, the coffee is burnt, the bagels are stale and so are the pastries.  I live in the neighborhood and I also have seen the same guy yelling at a lady walking her dog pass the place.  Her dog tinkled near one of the planters and he came running out yelling at her that now he has to wash off the whole side walk.  The lady looked mortified.  Noe Valley has always been a dog friendly neighborhood, which makes it so great when you see people sitting outside  a cafe with their little buddies by their side.  I don't ever see myself going to XO Cafe and feeling comfortable with my dog again.  Dog owners beware of this place.
author: Celeste D.

description: everything is good i love the salads the pumpkin pie chocolate cake great friendly service and super fast wifi
author: Chris C.

description: The lady with the short hair was really rude, a double latte to stay was in a mug, barely any weak foam and tasted like a single tall rather than the double I asked for. For the amount they charge for espresso drinks, the baristas seriously need to be retrained.
author: Nadia P.

description: When I walk in and smell the scent of fresh baking muffins, my mouth starts to water! It doesn't get any better than homemade bread pudding muffins and a fresh cup of Joe!! Love the service and will remain a loyal fan!!!
author: lucy p.

description:
I like the theme of this place, and I like how inviting and cozy it feels. What I don't like is the service and the prices. I came in, and I stood in front of the counter for 5 minutes, waiting for someone to help me, or at least say "I'll be right with you." The employees, and the owner, were just chatting away behind the large display of over priced desserts. I made eye contact with them, and no acknowledgement of my presence. So I turned around and left. 
 Everything there is over priced! You can make a whole chocolate cake, for what they sell a small slice for. One more thing, I really dislike, is how this place feels like a child care. So many moms with their loud babies and kids get in your way, and then take up much of the seating. I don't hate families, but when an establishment is so small, and you need to get work done on your computer, paying for a coffee and dessert pisses you off when you have no where to sit. One last thing I wanted to say is that this place closes far too early!!!! 6pm is too soon, especially if you are getting off of work! I found a new cafe, sort of near this one that is open until 10pm and with free internet. It's called the Other Alex Cafe (Near Mitchell's Ice Cream).  Much much bette, never going back to Cafe day care, I mean XO! :)
author: Gabriel T.

description: Update: 2 stars instead of 3. Why? It's hard to like a place when the staff doesn't seem to care about their clients.... An old man ordered a salad, the cashier didn't tell him that it would be made and placed at the other end of the 'counter' so he waited by the register. I was sitting down having coffee when the person made the salad, placed it on the end of the counter (silently) and went to talk to coworkers. The man stood and waited for close to five minutes before I got up and asked the girl what salad it was, then brought it to the man who was standing in the front waiting.  People who work there are oblivious to the experience their clients are having..... I'll stick with Martha's on Church, they have it going on...
author: Jill B.

description:
XO occupies a corner spot on the edge of Noe Valley. My first Mighty Leaf Tea experience occurred here; I had wondered what all the hype was about surrounding Mighty Leaf.  Now, I know--very good stuff, indeed.   

The cafe is clean and well-lit.  There's a decent amount of tables (finding a free one is hit or miss), cordial staff, and large windows for great people watching.  DSL is also available at two computer stations.  And the J and #24 stop right in front of the cafe for you lazy bastards.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
Best in Town!
Try the scrumptious muffins.
You are always served with a smile.
The anbience and very welcoming and inviting.
Wish there were more places like this.
Great place to chill!!
Cristina on Dolores street:-)
author: cristina k.

description:
I was ready to give this cafe a 4-stars (cute ambiance, not too crowded, wide selection of food choices) but must knock it down for the semi-rude response that my fiance received when he asked them to bus his plate.  

Don't come here looking for strong wi-fi signals or cheap lunches either because you'll surely be disappointed.  

The one plus is that they have some great desserts.  We tried their strawberry cheesecake and it was pretty damn good.
author: Tara T.

description:
We recently visited San Francisco and stayed near Cafe XO. We love everything about Cafe XO. The coffee (especially Coffee Mocha Milan) is very good. The pastries were fresh and delicious. Our favorites were the almond croissants (flaky, buttery and full of almond flavor --YUM) & the homemade Greek cookies :) The service was always good as well. The woman behind the counter greeted us every day. On our last night, knowing that we only came to visit, she gave us some extra cookies to enjoy on our flights. We really appreciated the great service and being treated so well :) 

Thank you, Cafe XO! We will stop by whenever we are in SF.
author: Ketty N.

description:
I've gotten a cup of french roast here every morning at 6:30am for the past 4 months on my commute out of town. At that early time the coffee is steamy fresh, and nice and strong. I really enjoy the pastries stuffed with cream-cheese, and blueberries on occasion. 
Nowadays I no longer commute that early so i'm only here once or twice a week, and I find that it's always super busy. Not my first choice for a hang out spot, but it's got so many windows that the light is ideal inside (faces south-west).
author: Rachel R.

description: visited this again because it's nearby but I struck out again.  Poor to mediocre food & service, ok atmosphere though loud, too expensive, & obnoxious owner
author: Jackson W.

description:
This is the best neighborhood coffee shop around.  The staff is courteous, the food is great, and the coffee/tea is amazing.  There is few wifi available as well.

Overall,  this is a clean and relaxing place to enjoy your time.  Generally it's only neighborhood people in there which is nice.  However, I always find someone from outside of the local area.  You truly should check this place out!
author: Eric S.

description:
I love the friendly neighborhood atmosphere and all the yummy menu items. The coffee is just ok though.

But on a sunny day nothing can beat a stroll down to XO to enjoy a hot cup and a sidewalk table. Especially since you don't have to wait an hour for the privilege.
author: Vanessa L.

description: Terrible coffee, made from a push button machine
author: Ash J.

description:
I look forward to the daily friendly greetings from serving staff,  Betty and Cynthia, who have my coffee order (robust  French Roast!) ready as I approach the counter.

When I do have the occasion to order one of  their FANTASTIC sandwiches for lunch, I especially look forward to the side salad and dressing (I always ask for extra dressing to use at home later).

It's nice to have the flavor  of "24th Street" at my corner of 30th and Church!    

Oh yeah - try the quiche (w/ salad) - they offer alternate choices: ham & cheese, feta, artichoke, etc... Take it home and warm it up for dinner...
author: hugh c.

description:
I get my coffee here every morning on my way to work. The coffee isn't amazing, but I like it better than the Starbucks option. It's a great place to bring your laptop and spend a couple of hours, although it's getting crowded and tough to find a spot on weekends ~

They make a lot of their pastries - and the spanakopitas are exxxcelent. I love the atmosphere, they have loungy chairs, the local news, and wifi!
author: Shipra K.

description: I've held off giving this place a negative review but today was the final straw.  Every single time I have been in there the service is painful.  Incredibly slow and inefficient or nonexistent.  Today was particularly irritating.  I walked in and went straight to the counter, no need to browse the huge case of unlabeled pastries, to order a croissant.  The woman at the register was too busy chatting and laughing with another coworker behind the counter.  She looks at me, continues chatting & giggling and they move their conversation over behind the espresso machine leaving me to stand there waiting.  On a more typical day I'm left standing there waiting behind people with a million questions because all the pastries are unlabeled.  Other times I'm standing there waiting and waiting and waiting and waiting until finally no one appears at all and my bus is arriving so I leave empty handed.  I leave annoyed each time I go in there.  Boooooooo!
author: Emily T.

description: Ok, first of all, what happened to the hours? Now the place closes at 6pm! I dropped a star for that! Overall, a nice neighborhood coffee shop with free wifi.
