You cant go wrong with their cappuchino and soy latte. Other reviewers hit the description pretty well, the place is always clean, cute, and cozy. I'm hanging out here more and more.
author: Vanessa W.

description: It's pretty cute in here and they have big comfy chairs.  I have only had coffee and it's petty good.  There is something missing, not sure what it is, but that's why it lost a star.  It's a nice place for studying though and the wifi is good!  Lots of great tea.
author: Reggie G.

description:
After a horrific experience at Muddy Water's near Mission and 29th St. I went to Cafe XO just to see if it was me or MW that was the problem.  
This cafe made my day.  Not only was the latte very good, and in a MUG and not a paper cup, but the selection of pastries was hugely admirable.  I had an excellent blueberry bread pudding and have since checked out more of their menu -- two thumbs up, even if that waffle was a dollar or two more than I wanted to pay.  The atmosphere is very pleasant, south-facing windows, wi-fi, a nice sitting room in the rear, and friendly staff.  A terrific neighborhood cafe all around.
author: Dean V.

description: Nice coffee and food. Recently renovated. Just a little pricey for everyday.
author: Peter H.

description: I will try something else on another to day to round out the review, but the coffee here isn't worth the price.  I got a Cafe au lait and it was watery tasting and the coffee didn't seem rich tasting at all.  However, the atmosphere and service was really nice.   I look forward to trying more on  another day.
author: Jorah N.

description: I can't believe I'm the first to review Cafe XO.  Whenever I drive by, it's packed with people clawing their way to the counter for coffee and delicious treats.  It's a nice little neighborhood spot in an area that desperately needed a meeting place for Noe dwellers.  I always order the Mighty Leaf passion green tea.  The coffee's not half bad, either.  I used to devour their chocolate chip cookies, but they've tasted different lately, and I'm heartbroken about it.  But their cakes and pies are a very good replacement.  The savory stuff isn't the best, but I don't usually patronize coffee places for their food.  Oh, and they also have a place for you laptop owners.   Order a latte and a pastry, have a seat and be a slug for a couple of hours.  It's a good place to be lazy.
author: Kristina R.

description: I love XO Cafe! The atmosphere is great, the food is good, and the desserts are WONDERFUL! And the staff and owner are really nice. I'm definitely a fan!  AND they have free wi-fi.  Why doesn't everyone else have free wi-fi.
author: Deanna G.

description: Cafe XO is one of my favorite places to study or catch up on work in Noe Valley!  You will need to come through with a full battery on your laptop because they have only like 3-4 power outlets available.  The inside has clean feel to it, as compared to a lot of the grimy cafes that flood San Francisco.  Really friendly staff here at XO.  A good portion of their sandwiches are good and they have a bunch of desserts to get your sweet tooth fill, but kinda of on the pricey side.  The coffee is cool, but try their Chai Latte!  It is the best you can find in SF even though it is a premix that they add milk to!
author: Jason A.

description: I want to like this place - I live around the corner.  But after 3-4 times there, I've come to the conclusion many others I know have -  the people are rude and everything is overpriced.
author: anopinio n.

description: A sweet little outpost on the Noe/Glen Park/Bernal border. Friendly service, plenty of coffee choices, and decent munchies. Apparently a nice place to chill out and mind the neighbors. It somehow comforts me to know it's there.
author: Megan W.

description: there is much better coffee, food and environment out there. Last time I went the cashier girl was pretty rude and there at least 3 different couples literally yelling at each other trying to talk over the other yellers. Not my thing.
author: courtney W.

description: Sticky bread pudding. Mm. Don't know many cafes where you can get bread pudding. Good coffee too. I'm not sure if the theme of this place is English, Asian, or Italian... just eclectic, I guess, but cozy. Nice little tables and cushy lounging chairs. Service is brisk, but not brusque. I'd go back, although its way off of my usual flight path.
author: Caitlin H.

description: Simply a good cafe and shop. Peaceful calm perfect
author: veggie m.

description: This place looks trendy and nice. The staff is very friendly. It's usually packed. I like the atmosphere - great place to chat with friends. However, the coffee is just average.
author: Barney M.

description: It looks really trendy, and it is, but the people who work there and the owner are very cool, nice people. The coffee is decent, but nothing to write home about. I stop in every once in awhile to say hello.
author: Scott M.

description: Have a sweet tooth? Enjoy an amazing belgian waffle covered with fresh fruit, homemade yogurt/whipped cream, and drizzled with chocolate shavings and caramel sauce? Perhaps sitting at the window looking out at the rain, or on a nice sunny day, outside at one of the tables in front? Or sitting inside with a book or just people watching? Or surfing the net for free using their wireless? Then XO Cafe (on corner of Church and 30th) is the place for you. Their latte's aren't bad either. I treat myself this way once every couple of months. :-)
author: beth l.

description: Don't come here, it's getting too crowded.  I want all of you to stay away from my favorite cafe in Noe Valley!!  Ok ok ok, fine...you can come here...but just get it to go.  Don't hang around too long, alright?
author: Tabatha Y.

description: Have you seen the GORGEOUS RED WALL. It is not just a red wall but it is the perfect shade. The romantic drop light, the cozy couch and WINDOWS. This is my favourite cafe in the united state. I used to travel for work and there is no place like XO. :) The pastry is fresh and yummy... great staff. A highlight in Noe and definitely make the neighbourhood so much more prettier and add character to my neighbourhood. :)
author: Ervinna L.

description: Watery, weak, cardboard-flavored coffee.  Awful.  The slice of peach pie I was served had mold in the middle of the slice.  Very unpleasant.  Which is too bad because the place is so cute and in a great location.
author: Carolyn S.

description:
With out Betty and Eugene this place would be good, but  not great. The baked goods are made by a man who used to own a bakery a few blocks away, and he has always been one of the best local bakers. Coffee is so great, and nicely priced, so glad it's right around the corner.

UPDATE:
My update has to reflect that fact that Betty is gone, Eugene is rarely there, and Adam saved my life. Literally. The whole Church and 30th crowd, we watch out for each other.
That given... the press coverage that a certain store near by where I work was receiving, on one of the worst days of my life, I got out of a cab my other job had so graciously sent me home in based on recent events, and stood talking to Adam and Betty for a brief moment. Dawning the store provided uniform and some highly ugly sunglasses the owner of whom I was unsure, a certain reporter of Asian American decent recognized me as an employee of said store, and headed straight towards me with a camera in tow. Knowing what was going on Adam and Betty quickly whisked me away into the back of Cafe XO and gave me a news paper to hide behind. Although said reporter pressured him into an interview Adam quickly signaled for me to hide in the bathroom and completely had my back... The one and probably only time I'll ever have to hide from paparazzi, Adam and Cafe XO saved me. For that, they truly are awesome.
author: Niki M.

description: Adorable corner Cafe - love the location, and cute cozy atmosphere.
author: Gina C.

description: My favourite coffee shop in Noe. Nice coffee, good service, great pastries, comfortable chairs and a great location. I'd give it five stars except for the fact that it's frequently a little hot and stuffy inside.
author: Colin M.

description: This place is really close to my office.  I only get 30 minutes for lunch usually so I spend it at my desk.  When I need to just get out of the office for awhile, I'll come here, grab a coffee and snack and chill out with my iPod and their wireles internet.  Pretty nice.  The staff is super nice and accommodating.  The coffee is okay.  The apple cider is delish.  And the pastries are awesome (cookies just okay.)  The best part is the sunlight they get shining through their windows.  It sure brightens up my day (pun intended...)
author: Angela S.

description: Came here to relax after a few mile walk with a close friend and enjoyed a tasy mocha and bagel with lox. Both were about standard in both price and taste--- Service seemed fine for a 2 star, but a plus one: As someone who loves watching trains, I would certainly go back and watch the J line as it turns the corner.
author: Vee B.

description: Very quaint neighborhood cafe in the Mission district.  Felt like the Cheers! of coffee shops.  Everyone seemed to know everyone else and the place was bustling at 10am when we stopped by.  Easy to park and right on the muni.  Friendly staff.  Very comfortable sitting areas.  Great coffee to boot!
author: Preston P.

description: My wife and I drove from San Jose to pick up custom made shoes for my wife who is disabled. Several yrs ago when a podiatrist recommended Pietro Fonda,whose shop is about three stores down from Cafe XO, to sew a strap on the shoe to better stabalize my wife's foot we came across Cafe XO and found it to be an enjoyable place. On this date following picking up the shoes we came by and my wife had their special smoothie for the day, and I had a roast turkey sandwich which for me was the best sandwich I have had. Maybe some as good but none better. It was real roasted turkey fresh off the turkey, with a wonderful fresh rye bread. And to my surprise the sandwich came with a small salad with fresh greens, not the usual iceberg lettuce and a wonderful balsamic dressing. I did not think I would eat the entire sandwich and would wrap up what was remaining and take home. But being hungry ate the entire sandwich. I also thought my coffee was excellent. I also thought the service was excellent being responsive and friendly.
author: John O.

description: really?  your service is still awful.  when someone is at the register ready to purchase something, it's really not the time to be blathering on to your friend who just stopped by.  get a clue.  and your coffee still sucks.
author: Kat R.

description: Still good, but if you want to use their wi-fi, don't sit way in the back -- the reception is really weak there.
author: moosedog i.

description: My neighborhood coffee shop right around the corner.  I love their coffee and the place is really cute inside.  Go there and chat and have fun!
author: Rob P.

description: We were visiting some friends for Thanksgiving and went here for lunch one day. It is a nice cafe with a ton of seating. The service was very pleasant and the food was good. My DH and I both had the Honey Roast Turkey Breast and our friends had the Homemade Tuna Salad. We didn't try any of the coffee or pastries so I can't comment on the taste but they did look good.
author: Kari S.

description: I love this spot. All of the pastries are made each morning by the owner himself..yum! The french roast coffee is awesome and the house blend isn't too bad. They have an amazing range of teas, free internet access and delicious food...I love that they put strawberries in the salads...delish!!! Wonderful wonderful spot, and a good place to people watch on a nice day!
author: Chloe D.

description: Great little cafe with a unique design.
author: Peter O.

description: I seriously can not believe no one has mentioned the belgian waffles here.  ?????? How did 25 people miss that?  They make them fresh, top them with fresh fruit and thick greek yogurt and drizzle with maple syrup and caramel sauce. It's a buttery, crisp yet melt in your mouth smooth, creamy, fruity, delicious slice of heavan.
author: Shelly H.

description: The coffee here is pretty weak but their food is surprisingly good.  My husband and I had lunch here a few days ago, and we were both pleased with our sandwiches.  If you're simply looking for good coffee, however, this is not the place for you.
author: Sharyn F.

description: I have to admit, I've never had their coffee, but they carry Mighty Leaf Tea, (I discovered it here, actually!) so I'm happy. The fireplace is a nice touch, and the pastries are yummy, too.
author: Emily T.

description: Had to post one more time about my favorite neighborhood cafe . . . they are just the best!  I love the employees there, they are so sweet, and really get to know their customers!  I find all of their sandwiches to be great, but recently have been enjoying their "special breakfast" lately as well.  Oh, and how do they make their orange juice taste so good?  My goodness!
author: Jenn K.

description: Gross coffee, consistently burnt tasting. Tables are sticky and a mess. Price is pretty much right on though, so it saves itself from being a one star join. Desperate in Noe Valley, you might be forced to get your cuppa joe here.
author: G J J.

description: Wow - I can't believe there are so few five star reviews for XO. They have the best coffee on Church street, free WiFi, yummy sandwiches and snacks, and comfy seating. If you go on Sunday, there are always a few abandoned New York Times papers to read.
author: Emily E.

description: Zero stars. My good friend told me the coffee sucked here, so we went ahead and ordered two very strong pots of loose leaf Darjeeling tea from the girl behind the counter. Not only was the tea especially weak, but it somehow also had camomile tea mixed in with it so as to render it wholly undrinkable.
author: Adam Z.

description: Great local coffee shop.  Good food, good coffee and cozy.   Only wish they were open later into the evening.
author: Jason M.

description:
I'm here a lot because it's right by my house. It's a very neighbourhood kind of place, and has as many parents with their kids in tow as it does standard laptop-toting san franciscan coffee house denizens. And that's great. As I see it, this place has two things going for it:

1) it's a pretty, sunny space, with huge glass windows right on a cute and bustling corner
2) it has genuinely good coffee (I'm surprised to see a couple of people here say this isn't so: this isn't the best in the city, but definitely the best for several blocks around)

But it has a bunch of things going against it, too...

1) lousy service: the staff will happily have a five minute conversation with each other between seeing you walk in and taking your order
2) you may need to bring headphones: most of the time they just play quiet inoffensive classical music or jazz, but every now and then someone behind the bar decides they really need to hear soft rock ballads played at high volume for an hour
3) the prices are just crazy -- not just on par for Noe Valley, overpriced.

on balance though, I'm more than happy this is my local coffee shop.
author: Hal T.

description: Wow!  I really love this cafe.  The owner Adam (who is a REALLY hot Greek guy) does the baking himself and you can tell, it's always fresh and tasty.  The atmosphere is cozy and classy and the service is friendly.  If you are in the neighborhood drop by!
author: Chris H.

description: All I've ever had here were a couple sips of hot chocolate and a madeleine. Both were okay, not spectacular. But the mere fact that I came in soaking wet from the pouring rain with an equally soggy three year old in tow, with no money ( the three y/o's father was on the way), and they gave me a hot chocolate on credit and let me stay until after closing deserves 4 stars, at least.
author: Deborah H.

description: the atmosphere is great and food usually enjoyable, I've been here a few times and looked forward to going back. With so many choices in SF was disappointed I wasted my afternoon out here. the food was average and the service down right rude. the short Hispanic woman is abrupt and after a mistake made in our order we were charged the extra they had apparently undercharged by not getting our order right the first time. As much as I love the sun and nice surroundings- I don't plan on making this mistake again.
author: deborah w.

description: Had a better experience upon last visit -- more attentive staff, good food. Still pricey.
author: Ed E.

description: This cafe is a gem. Great desserts and coffee. And please try the tuna sandwich, it is heaven, if you are in to tuna that is. The staff is excellent, super friendly, and fast. I especially love the Latino woman who works there, very sweet, efficient, and intelligent. If your in the hood stop by. The atmosphere is elegant and relaxing. This cafe make living in this neighborhood great. I've never had an issue with the customer service in this place. It seems that some of the other people making comments on this page need to take a vacation, work less, learn some relaxation techniques, and get over their privileged lives.
author: Liberty V.

description: Great drip coffee..much less acidic than Martha Brothers.  I walk here for coffee from Jersey/Church Street because it's better than the coffee offered at the coffee shops there.  That's all I can rate since that's all I've had...smells great inside and it's on a sunny corner if you want to sit outside in the morning/afternoon
author: Lew D.

description: i want to love cafe xo, i really do.  it is so cute and so close to my home, but... the coffee is terrible.  like coffee flavored water.  undrinkable.  and the latte i ordered- oh, man, oh man.  it was like bad coffee in too much milk.  i'll admit, i'm a bit picky about my coffee and especially my lattes, but really.. this was just so so so so so bad.  and this really stinks because cafe xo is in a perfect spot- right by the J and the 24, they have a lot to offer in the way of snacks and breakfasts (i had a breakfast bagel sandwich thing, it was ok, nothing to write home about, but i was too busy being depressed over the accompanying latte to really notice) and they serve mighty leaf tea (which is mighty good, and hard to ruin).   this place should be amazing, but it just makes me sad.
author: Samantha W.

description: Cafe XO is the place for a cafe experience that is relaxing and "all inclusive."  Although XO is often very crowded, I have no problem hanging out there for a couple of hours, never feeling pressured to leave.  They have a nice little section with comfy chairs around a small table, perfect for reading the newspaper.  The "all inclusive" part comes from the rather extensive menu offered.  Beyond your basic cafe grub, XO offers many tasty desserts, as well as a menu of "gourmet" salads and such.  Over all, I would probably give the savory menu 3 stars, and the sweet 4 stars.  Either way, XO offers much more food than your average cafe, without upsetting that "cafe feel" (i.e. it does not feel like a restaurant at all).  The coffee could be a little stronger (this coming from a guy who hears voices telling him to run away and become a mole chef in oaxaca when he has more that one cup of joe), but the mocha is delicious.  One other big plus is that XO has padded seats, so if (like me), a cruel trick of evolution has left you without an ass, you can still veg out for hours at a time.  PS...XO is a great place to study, and they also offer free wireless internet.
author: Mr. G.

description: Nevermind the fact that I was coming in everyday for my coffee, nor that I had tipped everytime, I could get no love from the people at XO.  Of course, I've seen others tap into the secret chambers of their hearts, but woe to my neighborhood coffee shop that I so badly wanted to be "let in" on.  But damn, their pastries are good!  The other edibles were munchilicious too, especially their quiches and sandmiches. Coffee was a little off, but oh those pastries....  They space is so homey and I hate to use this word, but it's a cute coffee shop.  Totally true about the J wailing ferociously around you within 15 minute intervals though.  But, if you stay for an hour, and it's a nice sunny day, they become part of the lively SF landscape.  It's the most inviting cafe I've been to yet, save for the coffee shope in downtown Tiburon.  I must be a masochist because I still miss this place ever since I moved out of the city....
author: Xandria S.

description: have to love the selection of handmade baked goods not to mention all of the other food. the sandwiches are awesome if you're willing to shell out about 8 bucks. i hear the breakfasts are to die. the coffee is always good and my daily mocha never fails! the service is genuine and the people are mostly friendly. check it out!!
author: Monica M.

description:
great place!

they have everything you need, from sandwiches, to pastries, with nice desserts, fruits, coffee... 

The place is cozy, with an interesting decor and nice people behind the counter.
author: Laurent C.

description: This place should be great - perfect location, European decor..  sadly, the coffee is weak diner quality, the 'get it yourself and we'll give you a bag' pastry counter is annoying, and mostly, they run out of the same pastry snacks every day.  A well run business would order more of the things people want and buy, and less of the things people don't want and don't buy.  But, no, XO doesn't adapt.  Their location affords them complacency.
author: Mark H.

description: Cafe XO is like having a little bit of Walnut Creek in San Francisco. Swanky, slightly overdone decor, a soundtrack of mostly Easy Listening music (think Sarah Brightman, Gypsy Kings, etc.), decent baked goods, overwrought sandwich plates with needless ornamantal garnishes, and thoroughly mediocre coffee. *Update* The vibe is still the same, but a lot of the baked goods can't even be described as 'decent' - the "Adam's Croissants" are the worst I've had since a Holiday Inn free buffet - gummy, doughy, barely edible. Cafe St. Jorge a few blocks away is a MUCH better choice.
author: tw s.

description: A great neighborhood meeting place for coffee, tea, pastries, and just hanging out.  The place is spotless, the service superb, and the clientele a friendly neighborhood mix.  Owner Adam takes special pride in his baking -- the polenta muffins are excellent -- and the great staff includes Betty, Cassandra, and Cynthia.  XO Cafe is one of the places that makes Upper Noe Valley special.
author: Peter E.

description: this is a great neighborhood spot that could do some really thrilling things, menu-wise. instead, the lunch menu is very overwrought with dressed-up sandwiches, too-spicy mustard, and capers. the fresh baked treats always look delicious, and the staff is polite, however overworked. XO is a reliable source for bagels and hot tea.
author: chaz w.

description: good coffee, fast free wifi, nice little tables with plenty of outlets around. atmosphere is a little posh for my tastes, but i am usually too absorbed in my work to notice. love the neighborhood. it's a pleasure to walk to.
author: Ben H.
